arabicText: ۞ وَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ مِن جُندٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنزِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	after	him,	We	did	not	send	down	any	
army	from	heaven	against	his	people,	nor	
did	We	intend	to	send	down	an	army
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	is	ke	b’ad	us	ki	qaum	par	
āasmān	se	koyi	lashkar	na	utārā	aur	na	
hameñ	wahāñ	koyi	lashkar	utārnā	thā.

arabicText: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ فَإِذَا هُمْ خَـٰمِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	was	just	one	scream,	and	with	it	they	
were	extinguished.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	to	bas	aik	hi	chikh	thi	jabhi	woh	bujh	
kar	rah	gaye.

arabicText: يَـٰحَسْرَةً عَلَى ٱلْعِبَادِ ۚ مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	was	said,	“Woe	to	those	bondmen	-	
whenever	a	Noble	Messenger	comes	to	
them,	they	mock	at	him!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kahā	gayā	ke	hāye	afsos	un	bandoñ	par	
jab	un	ke	pās	koyi	Rasool	āatā	hai	to	us	se	
thathā	hi	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Have	they	not	seen	how	many	generations	
We	destroyed	before	them,	which	will	not	
return	to	them?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā		unhoñ	ne	na	dekhā	Ham	ne	un	se	pahle	
kitni	sangateñ	halāk	farmāyiñ	ke	woh	ab	un	
ki	ṭaraf	palatne	wāle	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَإِن كُلٌّۭ لَّمَّا جَمِيعٌۭ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	without	exception,	all	of	them	will	be	
brought	forth	before	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jitne	bhi	haiñ	sab	ke	sab	hamāre	
ḥuzoor	ḥāzir	lāye	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: وَءَايَةٌۭ لَّهُمُ ٱلْأَرْضُ ٱلْمَيْتَةُ أَحْيَيْنَـٰهَا وَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهَا حَبًّۭا فَمِنْهُ يَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	a	sign	for	them	is	the	dead	earth;	We	
gave	it	life	and	We	produced	from	it	grain,	
so	they	eat	from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	us	meiñ	bāgh	banāye	
khujooroñ	aur	angoroñ	ke	aur	ham	ne	us	
meiñ	kuch	chashme	bahāye.

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّـٰتٍۢ مِّن نَّخِيلٍۢ وَأَعْنَـٰبٍۢ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلْعُيُونِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	placed	in	it	gardens	of	dates	
and	grapes,	and	We	have	made	springs	of	
water	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	us	ke	phaloñ	meiñ	se	khāyeñ	aur	ye	un	
ke	hath	ke	banāye	nahiñ	to	kyā		ḥaq	na	
māneñ	ge.

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّـٰتٍۢ مِّن نَّخِيلٍۢ وَأَعْنَـٰبٍۢ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلْعُيُونِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	placed	in	it	gardens	of	dates	
and	grapes,	and	We	have	made	springs	of	
water	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	us	meiñ	bāgh	banāye	
khujooroñ	aur	angoroñ	ke	aur	ham	ne	us	
meiñ	kuch	chashme	bahāye.

arabicText: لِيَأْكُلُوا۟ مِن ثَمَرِهِۦ وَمَا عَمِلَتْهُ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	that	they	may	eat	from	its	fruits,	
whereas	they	are	not	manufactured	by	
their	hands!	So	will	they	not	be	grateful?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	us	ke	phaloñ	meiñ	se	khāyeñ	aur	ye	un	
ke	hath	ke	banāye	nahiñ	to	kyā		ḥaq	na	
māneñ	ge.

arabicText: سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلْأَزْوَٰجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنۢبِتُ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَمِنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Purity	is	to	Him	Who	created	all	pairs,	from	
what	the	earth	grows,	and	of	themselves,	
and	from	the	things	they	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Pāki	hai	usey	jis	ne	sab	jode	banāye	un	chizoñ	se	jnheñ	zameen	ugāti	hai	aur	khud	un	se	aur	un	
chizoñ	se	jin	ki	unheñ	khabar	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَءَايَةٌۭ لَّهُمُ ٱلَّيْلُ نَسْلَخُ مِنْهُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُم مُّظْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	a	sign	for	them	is	the	night;	We	strip	the	day	out	of	it,	thereupon	they	are	in	darkness.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	un	ke	liye	aik	nishāni	rāt	hai	ham	us	par	se	din	khinch	lete	haiñ	jabhi	woh	andhere	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: وَٱلشَّمْسُ تَجْرِى لِمُسْتَقَرٍّۢ لَّهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْعَلِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	sun	runs	its	course	for	its	final	destination;	this	is	a	command	of	the	Almighty,	the	All	
Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	sooraj	chaltā	hai	apne	aik	thahrāō	ke	liye	yeh	ḥukm	hai	zabardast	‘Ilm	wāle	kā.

arabicText: وَٱلْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَـٰهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَٱلْعُرْجُونِ ٱلْقَدِيمِ
englishTranslationText: And	We	have	appointed	positions	for	the	moon	till	it	returns	like	an	old	branch	of	the	date	palm.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	chāñd	ke	liye	Ham	ne	manzileñ	muqarrar	kiñ	yahāñ	tak	ke	phir	ho	gayā	jaise	khujoor	ki	
purāni	dāl	(tahni).

arabicText: لَا ٱلشَّمْسُ يَنۢبَغِى لَهَآ أَن تُدْرِكَ ٱلْقَمَرَ وَلَا ٱلَّيْلُ سَابِقُ ٱلنَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّۭ فِى فَلَكٍۢ يَسْبَحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	not	for	the	sun	to	catch	up	with	the	moon,	nor	does	the	night	surpass	the	day;	and	each	one	
of	them	floats	in	its	orbit.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sooraj	ko	nahiñ	pahuñchtā	ke	chāñd	ko	pakad	le	aur	na	rāt	din	par	sabqat	le	jāye	aur	har	aik	aik	
ghere	meiñ	pair	rahā	hai.

arabicText: وَءَايَةٌۭ لَّهُمْ أَنَّا حَمَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
englishTranslationText:
And	a	sign	for	them	is	that	We	lodged	them	
in	a	laden	ship,	while	they	were	in	their	
forefathers	backs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	liye	aik	nishāni	ye	hai	ke	unhey	
un	ke	buzurgoñ	ki	pith	meiñ	ham	ne	bhari	
kashti	meiñ	sawār	kiyā	.

arabicText: وَخَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّن مِّثْلِهِۦ مَا يَرْكَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	created	for	them	similar	
ships,	in	which	they	now	ride.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	liye	waisi	hi	kashtiyāñ	banā	diñ	
jin	par	sawār	hote	haiñ.

arabicText: وَإِن نَّشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنقَذُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	will,	We	can	drown	them,	so	
there	would	be	no	help	in	their	distress,	
nor	would	they	be	saved.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	chāheñ	to	unheñ	dubo	deñ	to	na	
koyi	un	ki	faryād	ko	pahuñchn e	wālā	ho	
aur	na	woh	bachāye	jāyeñ.

arabicText: وَإِن نَّشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنقَذُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	will,	We	can	drown	them,	so	
there	would	be	no	help	in	their	distress,	
nor	would	they	be	saved.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	chāheñ	to	unheñ	dubo	deñ	to	na	
koyi	un	ki	faryād	ko	pahuñchn e	wālā	ho	
aur	na	woh	bachāye	jāyeñ.

arabicText: إِلَّا رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنَّا وَمَتَـٰعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Unless	by	mercy	from	Us,	and	as	a	comfort	
for	a	while.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	Hamāri	ṭaraf	ki	Raḥmat	aur	aik	
waqt	tak	baratne	denā.

arabicText: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّقُوا۟ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	it	is	said	to	them,	“Beware	of	
what	is	before	you	and	what	is	behind	you,	
in	the	hope	of	your	gaining	mercy”,	they	
turn	away!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	se	farmāyā	jātā	hai	daro	tum	us	
se	jo	tumhāre	sāmne	hai	aur	jo	tumhāre	
piche	āane	wālā	hai	is	ummid	par	ke	tum	
par	mehar	ho	to	moñh	pher	lete	haiñ.

arabicText: وَمَا تَأْتِيهِم مِّنْ ءَايَةٍۢ مِّنْ ءَايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	whenever	a	sign	comes	to	them	from	
the	signs	of	their	Lord,	they	always	turn	
away	from	it!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	kabhi	un	ke	rab	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	
koyi	nishāni	un	ke	pās	āati	hai	to	muñh	hi	
pher	lete	haiñ.

arabicText: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ أَنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَنُطْعِمُ مَن لَّوْ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ أَطْعَمَهُۥٓ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	it	is	said	to	them,	“Spend	in	
Allah’s	cause,	from	what	Allah	has	
provided	you”,	the	disbelievers	say	
regarding	the	believers,	“Shall	we	feed	
these,	whom	if	Allah	willed,	would	have	
fed?	You	are	not	but	in	open	error!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	se	farmāyā	jāye	Allāh	ke	diye	
meiñ	se	kuch	us	ki	rāh	meiñ	kharch	karo	to	
kāfir	musalmānoñ	ke	liye	kahte	haiñ	ke	kyā		ham	usey	khilāyeñ	jise	Allāh	chāhtā	to	khilā	detā	tum	
to	nahiñ	magar	khuli	gumrāhi	meiñ.

arabicText: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	they	say,	“When	will	this	promise	be	fulfilled,	if	you	are	truthful?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kahte	haiñ	kab	āaye	gā	ye	w’ada	agar	tum	sachche	ho.

arabicText: مَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيْحَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ تَأْخُذُهُمْ وَهُمْ يَخِصِّمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	await	just	one	scream,	which	will	overcome	them	while	they	are	involved	in	worldly	
disputes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Rāh	nahiñ	dekhte	magar	aik	chikh	ki	ke	unheñ	āa	le	gi	jab	woh	duniyā	ke	jhagde	meiñ	phañse	hoñ	
ge.

arabicText: فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ تَوْصِيَةًۭ وَلَآ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText: Therefore	neither	able	to	make	a	will,	nor	returning	to	their	homes.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	na	wasiyat	kar	sakeñ	ge	aur	na	apne	ghar	palat	kar	jāyeñ.

arabicText: وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَنسِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Trumpet	will	be	blown	-	so	they	will	come	forth	from	the	graves,	running	towards	their	
Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	phoñkā	jāye	gā	Soor	jabhi	woh	qabroñ	se	apne	rab	ki	ṭaraf	daudte	chaleñ	ge.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَا مَنۢ بَعَثَنَا مِن مَّرْقَدِنَا ۜ ۗ هَـٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَصَدَقَ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Saying,	“O	our	misfortune!	Who	has	raised	us	from	our	sleep?	This	is	what	the	Most	Gracious	had	
promised,	and	the	Noble	Messengers	had	spoken	the	truth!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kaheñ	ge	hāye	hamāri	kharābi	kis	ne	hameñ	sote	se	jagā	diyā	ye	hai	woh	jis	kā	Raḥmān	ne	w’ada	
diyā	thā	aur	Rasooloñ	ne	ḥaq	farmāyā.

arabicText: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ فَإِذَا هُمْ جَمِيعٌۭ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
englishTranslationText: It	is	just	one	scream,	and	every	one	of	them	will	be	brought	together	before	Us!
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	to	na	hogi	magar	aik	ching-hārd	jabhi	woh	sab	ke	sab	Hamāry	ḥuzoor	ḥāzir	ho	jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: فَٱلْيَوْمَ لَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌۭ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	this	day	no	soul	will	be	wronged	in	the	least;	and	you	will	not	be	compensated	except	for	your	
deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	āaj	kisi	jān	par	kuch	zulm	na	hogā	aur	tumheñ	badla	na	mile	gā	magar	apne	kiye	kā.

arabicText: إِنَّ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ٱلْيَوْمَ فِى شُغُلٍۢ فَـٰكِهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	this	day	the	dwellers	of	Paradise	
are	in	comfort,	with	blissful	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Jannat	wāle	āaj	dil	ke	bahlāwoñ	
meiñ	chain	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: هُمْ وَأَزْوَٰجُهُمْ فِى ظِلَـٰلٍ عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ مُتَّكِـُٔونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	and	their	wives	are	in	shades,	
reclining	on	thrones.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	aur	un	ki	bibiyāñ	sāyoñ	meiñ	haiñ	
takhtoñ	par	takiya	lagāye.

arabicText: لَهُمْ فِيهَا فَـٰكِهَةٌۭ وَلَهُم مَّا يَدَّعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	it	(paradise)	are	fruits	for	them	and	
whatever	they	ask	for.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	liye	us	meiñ	mewā	hai	aur	un	ke	liye	
hai	us	meiñ	jo	māngeñ.

arabicText: سَلَـٰمٌۭ قَوْلًۭا مِّن رَّبٍّۢ رَّحِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Upon	them	will	be	“Peace”	-	a	Word	from	
their	Merciful	Lord!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	liye	us	meiñ	mewā	hai	aur	un	ke	liye	
hai	us	meiñ	jo	māngeñ.

arabicText: سَلَـٰمٌۭ قَوْلًۭا مِّن رَّبٍّۢ رَّحِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Upon	them	will	be	“Peace”	-	a	Word	from	
their	Merciful	Lord!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	par	Salām	hogā	maharbān	Rab	kā	
farmāyā	huā.

arabicText: وَٱمْتَـٰزُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	be	separated	(from	others)	this	day,	O	
you	criminals!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āaj	alag	phat	jāō	aey	mujrimo.

arabicText: ۞ أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَـٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوا۟ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“O	Descendants	of	Adam!	Did	I	not	take	a	
covenant	from	you	that	you	shall	not	
worship	the	devil?	Undoubtedly,	he	is	your	
open	enemy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	aulād-e-Ādam!	Kyā	maiñ	ne	tum	se	
‘ahad	na	liyā	thā	ke	shaiṭān	ko	na	poojnā	
be-shak	woh	tumhārā	khulā	dushman	hai.

arabicText: وَأَنِ ٱعْبُدُونِى ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌۭ مُّسْتَقِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“And	that	you	shall	worship	Me?	This	is	the	
Straight	Path.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	meri	bandgi	karnā	ye	sidhi	rāh	hai.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَضَلَّ مِنكُمْ جِبِلًّۭا كَثِيرًا ۖ أَفَلَمْ تَكُونُوا۟ تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	he	has	indeed	led	a	large	number	of	
you	astray;	so	did	you	not	have	sense?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	us	ne	tum	meiñ	se	bahut	si	
khilqat	ko	bahkā	diyā	to	kyā	tumheñ	‘aql	
na	thi.

arabicText: هَـٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِى كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText: “This	is	hell,	which	you	were	promised.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	hai	woh	Jahannam	jis	kā	tum	se	w’ada	
thā.

arabicText: ٱصْلَوْهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Enter	it	this	day	-	the	recompense	of	your	
disbelief.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Āaj	is	meiñ	jāō	badla	apne	kufr	kā.

arabicText: ٱلْيَوْمَ نَخْتِمُ عَلَىٰٓ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَتُكَلِّمُنَآ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَتَشْهَدُ أَرْجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
This	day	We	will	set	a	seal	on	their	mouths,	
and	their	hands	will	speak	out	to	Us	and	their	
feet	will	bear	witness	to	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āaj	Ham	un	ke	muñhoñ	par	muhar	kar	deñ	
ge	aur	un	ke	hath	ham	se	bāt	kareñ	ge	aur	
un	ke	pāōñ	un	ke	kiye	ki	gawāhi	deñ	ge.

arabicText: وَلَوْ نَشَآءُ لَطَمَسْنَا عَلَىٰٓ أَعْيُنِهِمْ فَٱسْتَبَقُوا۟ ٱلصِّرَٰطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	had	We	willed,	We	could	have	quenched	their	eyes	so	they	would	rush	towards	the	path,	
unable	to	see	a	thing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	chāhte	to	un	ki	āañkheñ	mitā	dete	phir	lapak	kar	raste	ki	ṭaraf	jāte	to	unheñ	kuch	
na	soojhtā.

arabicText: وَلَوْ نَشَآءُ لَمَسَخْنَـٰهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمْ فَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ مُضِيًّۭا وَلَا يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	had	We	willed,	We	could	have	disfigured	their	faces	while	they	were	in	their	homes,	
therefore	unable	to	go	forward	or	turn	back.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	Ham	chāhte	to	un	ke	ghar	baithe	un	ki	soorateñ	badal	dete	ke	na	āage	badh	sakte	na	
piche	laut-te.

arabicText: وَمَن نُّعَمِّرْهُ نُنَكِّسْهُ فِى ٱلْخَلْقِ ۖ أَفَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	whomever	We	bring	to	an	old	age,	We	reverse	him	in	creation;	so	do	they	not	understand?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jise	ham	badi	‘umr	kā	kareñ	usey	paidāish	meiñ	ultā	phereñ	to	kyā		woh	samajhte	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَمَا عَلَّمْنَـٰهُ ٱلشِّعْرَ وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌۭ وَقُرْءَانٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	not	taught	him	(Prophet	Muhammad-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	to	recite	
poetry,	nor	does	it	befit	him;	it	is	nothing	but	an	advice	and	the	bright	Qur’an.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	un	ko	sh’er	kā	kahnā	na	sikhāyā	aur	na	woh	un	ki	shān	ke	lāiq	hai	woh	to	nahiñ	magar	
nasiḥat	aur	roshan	Qurān.

arabicText: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيًّۭا وَيَحِقَّ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	not	taught	him	(Prophet	Muhammad-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	to	recite	
poetry,	nor	does	it	befit	him;	it	is	nothing	but	an	advice	and	the	bright	Qur’an.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	warn	the	living	*,	and	to	prove	the	Word	against	disbelievers.	(Only	the	believers	are	deemed	
alive	in	Allah’s	sight.)

arabicText: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيًّۭا وَيَحِقَّ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
To	warn	the	living	*,	and	to	prove	the	Word	against	disbelievers.	(Only	the	believers	are	deemed	
alive	in	Allah’s	sight.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	usey	darāye	jo	zinda	ho	aur	kāfiroñ	par	bāt	sābit	ho	jāye.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّمَّا عَمِلَتْ أَيْدِينَآ أَنْعَـٰمًۭا فَهُمْ لَهَا مَـٰلِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	they	not	see	that	We	have	created	
animals	for	them	from	Our	handiwork,	so	
they	are	their	owners?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā	unhoñ	ne	na	dekhā	ke	ham	ne	
apne	hath	ke	banāye	huye	chaupāye	un	ke	
liye	paidā	kiye	to	ye	un	ke	mālik	haiñ.

arabicText: وَذَلَّلْنَـٰهَا لَهُمْ فَمِنْهَا رَكُوبُهُمْ وَمِنْهَا يَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	have	subjected	the	animals	for	them,	
so	they	ride	some	animals	and	eat	some?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheñ	un	ke	liye	narm	kar	diyā	to	kisi	
par	sawār	hote	haiñ	aur	kisi	ko	khāte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مَنَـٰفِعُ وَمَشَارِبُ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	for	them	in	the	animals	are	numerous	
different	benefits	and	drinks;	so	will	they	
not	be	grateful?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	liye	un	meiñ	kayi	ṭaraḥ	ke	nafa’a	
aur	pine	ki	chizeñ	haiñ	to	kyā		shukr	na	
kareñ	ge.

arabicText: وَٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةًۭ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	have	appointed	Gods	other	than	
Allah,	that	perhaps	they	may	be	helped!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unhoñ	ne	Allāh	ke	siwā	aur	khudā	
thahrā	liye	ke	shāyad	un	ki	madad	ho.

arabicText: لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُمْ جُندٌۭ مُّحْضَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	(the	appointed	Gods)	cannot	help	
them;	and	they	and	their	armies	will	come	
(to	Us),	as	captives.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	un	ki	madad	nahiñ	kar	sakte	aur	woh	
un	ke	lashkar	sab	giriftār	ḥāzir	āayeñ	ge.

arabicText: فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّا نَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	do	not	
grieve	because	of	what	they	(the	
disbelievers)	say;	indeed	We	know	what	
they	conceal	and	what	they	disclose.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	un	ki	bāt	kā	gham	na	karo	be-shak	
ham	jānte	haiñ	jo	woh	chupāte	haiñ	aur	
zāhir	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلًۭا وَنَسِىَ خَلْقَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ مَن يُحْىِ ٱلْعِظَـٰمَ وَهِىَ رَمِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	did	not	man	see	that	We	have	created	
him	from	a	drop	of	semen?	Yet	he	is	an	
open	quarreller!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā		āadmi	ne	na	dekhā	ke	ham	ne	usey	
pāni	ki	boñd	se	banāyā	jabhi	woh	sareeḥ	
jhagrdālu	hai.

arabicText: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلًۭا وَنَسِىَ خَلْقَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ مَن يُحْىِ ٱلْعِظَـٰمَ وَهِىَ رَمِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	invents	an	example	for	Us,	while	
forgetting	his	own	creation,	saying,	“Who	
is	such	that	can	revive	the	bones	when	
they	have	completely	rotted	away?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hamāre	liye	kahāwat	kahtā	hai	aur	
apni	paidāish	bhool	gayā	bola	aisā	kaun	hai	
ke	haddiyoñ	ko	zinda	kare	jab	woh	bilkul	
gal	gayiñ.

arabicText: قُلْ يُحْيِيهَا ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَهَآ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۢ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلْقٍ عَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“They	will	be	revived	by	
the	One	Who	created	them	the	first	time;	and	He	is	the	All	Knowing	of	every	creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	unheñ	woh	zinda	kare	gā	jis	ne	pahli	bār	unheñ	banāyā	aur	usey	har	paidāish	kā	‘ilm	
hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّجَرِ ٱلْأَخْضَرِ نَارًۭا فَإِذَآ أَنتُم مِّنْهُ تُوقِدُونَ
englishTranslationText: “The	One	Who	has	created	for	you	fire	from	the	green	tree,	so	you	kindle	from	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	tumhāre	liye	harey	ped	meiñ	se	āag	paidā	ki	jabhi	tum	us	se	sulgāte	ho.

arabicText: أَوَلَيْسَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِقَـٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ ٱلْخَلَّـٰقُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	is	it	not	possible	for	the	One	Who	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth	to	create	the	likes	of	
them?	It	is	surely	possible,	why	not?	And	He	is	the	Great	Creator,	the	All	Knowing	of	everything.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kyā		woh	jis	ne	āasmān	aur	zameen	banāye	un	jaise	aur	nahiñ	banā	saktā	kyuñ	nahiñ	aur	
wohi	hai	badā	paidā	karne	wālā	sab	kuch	jāntā

arabicText: إِنَّمَآ أَمْرُهُۥٓ إِذَآ أَرَادَ شَيْـًٔا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
englishTranslationText: And	His	only	task	when	He	intends	a	thing	is	to	command	it,	“Be”	-	and	it	thereupon	happens!
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	kā	kām	to	yahi	hai	ke	jab	kisi	chiz	ko	chāhe	to	us	se	famāye	ho	jā	woh	fauran	ho	jāti	hai.

arabicText: فَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱلَّذِى بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	Purity	is	to	Him	in	Whose	Hand	*	is	the	control	over	all	things	and	it	is	towards	Him	
that	you	will	be	returned.	(Used	as	a	metaphor	to	mean	Power).
romanUrduTranslationText: To	pāki	hai	Usey	jis	ke	hāth	har	cheez	kā	qabza	hai	aur	Usi	ki	ṭaraf	phere	jāō	ge.

arabicText: وَٱلصَّـٰٓفَّـٰتِ صَفًّۭا
englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	those	who	establish	proper	ranks.
romanUrduTranslationText: Qasam	un	ki	ke	bā-qā’ida	saff 	bāñdheñ

arabicText: فَٱلزَّٰجِرَٰتِ زَجْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	by	oath	of	those	who	herd	with	a	stern	
warning.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	unki	ke	jhidak	kar	chalāyeñ.

arabicText: فَٱلتَّـٰلِيَـٰتِ ذِكْرًا
englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	groups	that	read	the	Qur’an.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	un	jamā’atoñ	ki	ke	qurān	padheñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ إِلَـٰهَكُمْ لَوَٰحِدٌۭ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	your	God	is	surely	only	One.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	tumhārā	ma’abod	zaroor	aik	hai.

arabicText: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ
englishTranslationText:
Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	all	that	is	
between	them	-	and	the	Lord	of	the	sun’s	rising	
points.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mālik	āasmān	aur	zameen	kā	aur	jo	kuch	in	ke	
darmiyān	hai	aur	mālik	mashriqoñ	kā

arabicText: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلْكَوَاكِبِ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	adorned	the	lowest	heaven	
with	stars	as	ornaments.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	niche	ke	āasmān	ko	tāroñ	ke	singār	
se	āarāsta	kiyā	.

arabicText: وَحِفْظًۭا مِّن كُلِّ شَيْطَـٰنٍۢ مَّارِدٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	to	protect	it	from	every	rebellious	devil.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	nigāh	rakhne	ko	har	shaiṭān	sarkash	se.

arabicText: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَإِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
They	cannot	listen	to	the	speech	of	those	on	
higher	elevations	and	they	are	targeted	from	
every	side.
romanUrduTranslationText:
‘Āalam-e-bālā	ki	ṭaraf	kān	nahiñ	lagā	sakte	aur	un	
par	har	ṭaraf	se	mār	pheñk	hoti	hai.

arabicText: دُحُورًۭا ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ وَاصِبٌ
englishTranslationText:
To	make	them	flee,	and	for	them	is	a	never
ending	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: Unheñ	bhagāne	ko	aur	un	ke	liye	hamesha	kā	‘aƶāb

arabicText: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ ٱلْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌۭ ثَاقِبٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Except	one	who	sometimes	steals	a	part,	so	a	
blazing	flame	goes	after	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	jo	aik	āadh	bār	uchak	le	chalā	to	roushan	
angārā	us	ke	piche	lagā.
